column4: I can't seem to install ie6 successfully using winetricks in lucid. Can anyone help me?
try http://www.tatanka.com.br/ies4linux/page/Main_Page
tried that too, didn't work either.
did u try playonlinux?
seems like some key files that need to download from MS site aren't available anymore....
no I sure didn't.
ohh ok.. I'm not sure about the files missing from MS site, but may be you can try playonlinux
says: "setup was unable to download the required components. please make sure you are connected to the internet, or try to run setup again later."
hmm
ok pingoo
the message was from a windows update IE box.
ok.. in that case, may be those files are really missing from the MS server or may be the server is down temporarily
didn't work yesterday either.
ohh
that's not good, I really need ie6 installed bad or else I'm gonna have to use windows instead.
grrrrrrrrr
installing playonlinux. we'll see what happens there.
yeah it knows which version of wine to use for which windows application
cool thanks pingoo
ok all the best!
If you have a windows license, then try using Oracle's VirtualBox
in which case, you do not need to leave Linux.
both work in tandem
the reason I want to use wine is to remove complexity. I'm getting laptops ready for people in the field.
